intro: Eriocaulon kunmingense, commonly known as the Kunming sedge, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and specialized reproductive structures. It is native to China, particularly in the Yunnan Province, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, grass-like leaves, and its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, spike-like flowers. It plays a role in maintaining soil stability and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species requiring conservation efforts.
